instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .

threads.title: 820 00875 - No image
threads.message:
Hey , 

This one 1st time come with a bubble on <CHIP>U3200</CHIP>, i replace that one and go to the client but after 7 days comes again! 

I replace again <CHIP>U3200</CHIP> and the machine comes to life again!  when I start assembling the mac i noticed that mac don't show image. 

Now when i plug the charger or battery the machine start without press the button on/off.  I see that the fan spin and after 10 sec stop but still working! 

i already replace <CHIP>U3100</CHIP> + <CHIP>U3200</CHIP> again and tied new bios but same history! 

any suggestions ? 

thanks

threads.title: 820 00875 - No image
threads.message:
<CHIP>U3200</CHIP> burnt two times can be sign of chinese charger.

Do you get USB activity now, only missing image?
Check <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> signal.
